query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
1 In forma dunque di candida rosa 2 mi si mostrava la milizia santa 3 che nel suo sangue Cristo fece sposa;
query.error: **English:** 1 In the form, then, of a white rose 2 the holy host showed itself to me, 3 which Christ made his bride with his blood;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
4 ma l’altra, che volando vede e canta 5 la gloria di colui che la ’nnamora 6 e la bontà che la fece cotanta,
query.error: **English:** 4 but the other, which flying sees and sings 5 the glory of him who enamors it 6 and the goodness that made it so great,
query.result: 4 ac ðæt oðer, ðe fleogende gesihð and singð 5 ðæs wuldor ðæs ðe hyne onlufað 6 and ða godnysse ðe hyne geworhte swa micelne,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
7 sì come schiera d’ape che s’infiora 8 una fïata e una si ritorna 9 là dove suo laboro s’insapora,
query.error: **English:** 7 like a troop of bees that flowers itself 8 at one time and at another returns 9 to where its labor is savored,
query.result: 7 swylce heap beona ðe geblostmað hyne 8 æt anum cyrre and æt oðrum cyrð 9 ðær hyra geswinc bið geswetelod,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
10 nel gran fior discendeva che s’addorna 11 di tante foglie, e quindi risaliva 12 là dove ’l süo amor sempre soggiorna.
query.error: **English:** 10 descended into the great flower that adorns itself 11 with so many leaves, and then ascended again 12 to where its love always dwells.
query.result: 10 on ða myclan blostman stigon ðe gefrætewað hyne 11 mid swa manegum leafum, and ðanon eft stigon 12 ðær hyra lufu symle wunað.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
13 Le facce tutte avean di fiamma viva 14 e l’ali d’oro, e l’altro tanto bianco, 15 che nulla neve a quel termine arriva.
query.error: **English:** 13 Their faces all had the color of living flame, 14 and their wings were gold, and the rest of them so white, 15 that no snow reaches that degree.
query.result: 13 Heora nebba wæron ealle fyres hue, 14 and heora wengan gyldene, and ðæt oðer hwit, 15 ðæt nænig snaw to ðæm gemete ne cymeð.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
16 Quando scendean nel fior, di banco in banco 17 porgevan de la pace e de l’ardore 18 ch’elli acquistavan ventilando il fianco.
query.error: **English:** 16 When they descended into the flower, from bench to bench, 17 they offered each other peace and the burning love 18 that they acquired by fanning their sides.
query.result: 16 Þa hi nyðer stigon on ða blostman, of benche on benche, 17 hi sylfon frið and ða fyrhoðe 18 ðe hi begeaton wepende ða sidan.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
19 Né l’interporsi tra ’l disopra e ’l fiore 20 di tanta moltitudine volante 21 impediva la vista e lo splendore:
query.error: **English:** 19 Nor did the interposition between the above and the flower 20 of so great a flying multitude 21 impede the sight and the splendor:
query.result: 19 Ne ðæs betweox ðam ufera and ðam flore 20 ðære micclan menigu fleogendra 21 ða gesihðe and ðone sciman forstode:

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
22 ché la luce divina è penetrante 23 per l’universo secondo ch’è degno, 24 sì che nulla le puote essere ostante.
query.error: **English:** 22 for the divine light is penetrating 23 through the universe according to how worthy it is, 24 so that nothing can obstruct it.
query.result: 22 forðæm ðe ðæt godcunde leoht is ðurhwunigende 23 ðurh ðone world æfter ðæm ðe he wyrðe is, 24 swa ðæt him nænig ðing ne mæg beon wiðstandende.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
25 Questo sicuro e gaudïoso regno, 26 frequente in gente antica e in novella, 27 viso e amore avea tutto ad un segno.
query.error: **English:** 25 This secure and joyful kingdom, 26 frequented by people of old and new, 27 had its vision and love all directed to one point.
query.result: 25 Þeos trym and þeos torhtnysse rice, 26 oft gesyne ðam ealdan and ðam geongan, 27 hæfde hyra gesyhð and hyra lufe ealle to anum.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
28 O trina luce che ’n unica stella 29 scintillando a lor vista, sì li appaga! 30 guarda qua giuso a la nostra procella!
query.error: **English:** 28 O threefold light that in a single star 29 sparkling before their sight, so satisfies them! 30 Look down here upon our tempest!
query.result: 28 Eala ðreo-leohte leoht ðe on anum steorran 29 scinendum him on gesyhðe, swa hie geðafiað! 30 Loca nu her niðer to urum storme!

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
31 Se i barbari, venendo da tal plaga 32 che ciascun giorno d’Elice si cuopra, 33 rotante col suo figlio ond’ ella è vaga,
query.error: **English:** 31 If the barbarians, coming from such a region 32 that every day is covered by the constellation of Ursa Major, 33 rotating with its son around which it revolves,
query.result: 31 Gif ða hæðenan, cumande of ðære stowe 32 ðe ælc dæg Elig byð oferwrigen, 33 ymb-hweorfende mid his suna ðe heo ymb lyfð,

Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
40 di che stupor dovea esser compiuto! 41 Certo tra esso e ’l gaudio mi facea 42 libito non udire e starmi muto.
query.error: **English:** 40 with what astonishment should I have been filled! 41 Surely between it and joy I was made 42 to desire not to hear and to remain silent.
query.result: 40 mid hwylcum wundre sceolde beon gefylled! 41 Soðlice betwux ðam and ðam gefean me worhte 42 willan nawiht to gehyranne and beon dumb.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
43 E quasi peregrin che si ricrea 44 nel tempio del suo voto riguardando, 45 e spera già ridir com’ ello stea,
query.error: **English:** 43 And like a pilgrim who, resting 44 in the temple of his vow, looks around, 45 and hopes to be able to tell again how it stands,
query.result: 43 And swa swa ðone wælgrim ðe his wissunge 44 on ðæs temples geat tyhð, lociað, 45 and ðæs wenungað he ðær wære,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
46 su per la viva luce passeggiando, 47 menava ïo li occhi per li gradi, 48 mo sù, mo giù e mo recirculando.
query.error: **English:** 46 I, walking along the living light, 47 moved my eyes over the tiers, 48 now up, now down, and now circling around.
query.result: 46 ofer ða lybban leoht liðende, 47 ic ða eagan wende ofer ða weallas, 48 nu upp, nu niðer, and nu ymbemearce.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
49 Vedëa visi a carità süadi, 50 d’altrui lume fregiati e di suo riso, 51 e atti ornati di tutte onestadi.
query.error: **English:** 49 I saw faces turned to charity, 50 adorned with light from others and with their own smiles, 51 and their actions were adorned with all virtues.
query.result: 49 Ic geseah ðær wlite on sibbe gewende, 50 oðres leohtes leohte and ðæs hyra blissum, 51 and ða deawas mid eallum ðeawum gefrætewod.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
61 Diffuso era per li occhi e per le gene 62 di benigna letizia, in atto pio 63 quale a tenero padre si convene.

query.result: 61 Toflowen wæs ðurh ða eagan and ða wlite 62 ðære benigne blisse, on ðam bilewite, 63 swa hit geðafen is fæder to cildum.

Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
67 e se riguardi sù nel terzo giro 68 dal sommo grado, tu la rivedrai 69 nel trono che suoi merti le sortiro».

query.result: 67 and gif ðu locast upp on ðone ðriddan hring 68 of ðam hehstan stepe, ðu ðær eft gesihst 69 on ðam setle ðe hire ðegnunga ðær gesettan."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
70 Sanza risponder, li occhi sù levai, 71 e vidi lei che si facea corona 72 reflettendo da sé li etterni rai.
query.error: **English:** 70 Without answering, I raised my eyes, 71 and saw her who was making herself a crown 72 by reflecting from herself the eternal rays.
query.result: 70 Butan andsware, ða eagan up ic ahof, 71 and ða geseah ic ða ðe hire sylfne befrætewde 72 beorhte beámas of ðam écan leohte.

Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.

Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
76 quanto lì da Beatrice la mia vista; 77 ma nulla mi facea, ché süa effige 78 non discendëa a me per mezzo mista.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
82 di tante cose quant’ i’ ho vedute, 83 dal tuo podere e da la tua bontate 84 riconosco la grazia e la virtute.
query.error: **English:** 82 of all the things that I have seen, 83 I recognize the grace and the power 84 from your power and your goodness.
query.result: 82 ðara ðinga ðe ic geseah fela, 83 ðin geweald and ðine godcundnysse 84 ic oncneow ðurh ðine mihte and ðine mærða.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
85 Tu m’hai di servo tratto a libertate 86 per tutte quelle vie, per tutt’ i modi 87 che di ciò fare avei la potestate.
query.error: **English:** 85 You have brought me from servitude to liberty 86 through all those ways, through all those modes 87 by which you had the power to do so.
query.result: 85 ðu me hæfst of ðeowdome to frige geteod 86 ðurh ða wegas ealle, ðurh ða wisan ealle 87 ðe ðu mihtest gewealdan ðæt ðu swa dydest.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
88 La tua magnificenza in me custodi, 89 sì che l’anima mia, che fatt’ hai sana, 90 piacente a te dal corpo si disnodi».

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
97 vola con li occhi per questo giardino; 98 ché veder lui t’acconcerà lo sguardo 99 più al montar per lo raggio divino.
query.error: **English:** 97 fly with your eyes through this garden; 98 for seeing it will prepare your gaze 99 to ascend further by the divine ray.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
100 E la regina del cielo, ond’ ïo ardo 101 tutto d’amor, ne farà ogne grazia, 102 però ch’i’ sono il suo fedel Bernardo».
query.error: **English:** 100 And the queen of heaven, for whom I burn 101 all with love, will grant us every grace, 102 because I am her faithful Bernard."
query.result: 100 And seo heofona cwên, for ðære ic byrne 101 eall of lufe, us gegearwiað ælce gife, 102 forðæm ðe ic eom hire getreowa Beornheard."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
103 Qual è colui che forse di Croazia 104 viene a veder la Veronica nostra, 105 che per l’antica fame non sen sazia,

query.result: 103 Swylce se ðe ðonne mæg of Croatlande 104 cumeð to ðære Veronican ure, 105 ðe ðurh ða ealdan hungor ne bið sacgad,

106 ma dice nel pensier, fin che si mostra: 107 ‘Segnor mio Iesù Cristo, Dio verace, 108 or fu sì fatta la sembianza vostra?’;
query.error: **English:** 106 but says in his thought, as long as it is shown: 107 ‘My Lord Jesus Christ, true God, 108 was your likeness really like this?’;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
109 tal era io mirando la vivace 110 carità di colui che ’n questo mondo, 111 contemplando, gustò di quella pace.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.

115 ma guarda i cerchi infino al più remoto, 116 tanto che veggi seder la regina 117 cui questo regno è suddito e devoto».

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
118 Io levai li occhi; e come da mattina 119 la parte orïental de l’orizzonte 120 soverchia quella dove ’l sol declina,
query.error: **English:** 118 I lifted up my eyes; and as in the morning 119 the eastern part of the horizon 120 surpasses that where the sun declines,
query.result: 118 Ic ða up ahof mine eagan; and swa swa on morgen 119 ðæs eastdæles ende oferglenged 120 ðone ðær ðe sunu on setlgonge lið,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
121 così, quasi di valle andando a monte 122 con li occhi, vidi parte ne lo stremo 123 vincer di lume tutta l’altra fronte.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
124 E come quivi ove s’aspetta il temo 125 che mal guidò Fetonte, più s’infiamma, 126 e quinci e quindi il lume si fa scemo,
query.error: **English:** 124 And as here, where the chariot is awaited 125 that Phaethon guided badly, it grows hotter, 126 and on this side and that the light grows dimmer,
query.result: 124 And swa her, ðær ðæs wænes wen is 125 ðe Feþon misferde, ðær hit wearmra bið, 126 and on ða healfe and ða oðre ðæt leoht bið dimme,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
127 così quella pacifica oriafiamma 128 nel mezzo s’avvivava, e d’ogne parte 129 per igual modo allentava la fiamma;
query.error: **English:** 127 so that peaceful golden flame 128 grew brighter in the middle, and on every side 129 the flame grew dimmer in equal measure;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
130 e a quel mezzo, con le penne sparte, 131 vid’ io più di mille angeli festanti, 132 ciascun distinto di fulgore e d’arte.
query.error: **English:** 130 and in that middle, with their wings spread, 131 I saw more than a thousand joyful angels, 132 each distinct in brilliance and artistry.
query.result: 130 and on ðam midle, ða feðre toferede, 131 ða ic ðær geseah ðusenda engla and ma 132 æghwilcne syndrig scinendum and glædum.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
133 Vidi a lor giochi quivi e a lor canti 134 ridere una bellezza, che letizia 135 era ne li occhi a tutti li altri santi;
query.error: **English:** 133 I saw them there, in their games and songs, 134 laughing, a beauty that brought joy 135 to the eyes of all the other saints;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
136 e s’io avessi in dir tanta divizia 137 quanta ad imaginar, non ardirei 138 lo minimo tentar di sua delizia.
query.error: **English:** 136 and if I had as much skill in speaking 137 as I have in imagining, I would not dare 138 to attempt the least description of her delight.
query.result: 136 and gif ic hæfde on me swa micelne cræft 137 to secganne swa ic hæbbe to ðencenne, 138 ne dorste ic ðeah ðære wynne lytlæst mælan.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
139 Bernardo, come vide li occhi miei 140 nel caldo suo caler fissi e attenti, 141 li suoi con tanto affetto volse a lei,
query.error: **English:** 139 Bernardo, when he saw my eyes 140 fixed and intent on his warm glow, 141 turned his own to her with such affection,
query.result: 139 Beornard, ða he geseah ða eagan mine 140 on ðam hatan his hatan fæste and georne, 141 wende ða his mid swilcum lufan to hire,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
142 che ’ miei di rimirar fé più ardenti.
query.error: **English:** 142 that it made my desire to gaze upon her even more ardent.
query.result: 142 ðæt min mod ðæs wilnunge weox swiðor.
